fields.answer: Just click the Forgot Password link on the Sign-In page. A security code will be sent to you to allow you to reset your password.

fields.question: What happens when the promotion ends?
fields.answer: Your Amazon Prime Video membership continues uninterrupted as you are auto-enrolled into a monthly payment plan of the standard price of €5.99. You can cancel this membership should you wish to discontinue the service and you will no longer be billed.

fields.question: What happens if I need help troubleshooting?
fields.answer: For any problems with Prime Video, customers can contact the Amazon chat team.

title: 4K TV service
description: 4K, also known as UHD (Ultra HD), is the next generation standard of high definition TV content, offering a massive increase in picture clarity (resolution) compared to previous HD standards.

fields.question: Benefits of 4K
fields.answer:
Compared to current HDTV standard (1080p):

  • 4K offers a massive increase in picture quality compared to the current HD standard (720p or 1080p).
  • 4K video has four times the number of pixels (resolution) on screen compared to 1080p.
  • More pixels means more image detail. The picture will be more clear, especially on larger TVs.


Did you know? 4K gets its name from the number of horizontal pixels displayed on the screen—just short of 4000 (3840). 4K may also be referred to as "2160p" (the number of vertical pixels on the screen).

fields.question: How to watch 4K content?
fields.answer:
To get 4K on our TV service, you must be using our 4K equipment and a 4K TV. If you're using a home theatre receiver, it must also support 4K.

Requirements

  • 4K TV Player (supplied by us)
  • High Speed or Ultra High-Speed HDMI cable (supplied by us)
  • 4K compatible TV set
  • TV channel subscription or streaming service that includes 4K content
  • Minimum 25 Mbps internet connection for streaming online 4K content

fields.question: 4K streaming apps
fields.answer:
You can stream 4K content via STB apps like Netflix, YouTube, and Amazon Prime Video.

  • Netflix
    • Requires subscription to a premium plan to access 4K content.
  • YouTube
    • Creators have the option to upload content in 4K.
    • Videos available in 4K have an option for 2160p (4K) in resolution settings.
  • Amazon Prime Video
    • Select titles are available in 4K.
    • Video quality is shown at the bottom left of playback controls while watching content.


Availability of 4K content depends on the app and may require an additional subscription from that streaming service provider. A minimum 25 Mbps Internet connection is required for streaming 4K content.

fields.question: Do I need to subscribe separately to 4K content?
fields.answer:
Any package that comes with the regular HD version of a channel will also include the 4K version. If you're already subscribed to the HD version, you don't need a separate subscription for the 4K version.

For example, a Total TV subscription includes both TSN and Sportsnet, which also includes the 4K version of those channels.

fields.question: How do I know if my TV supports 4K?
fields.answer: Please refer to your TV manual to see if it supports 4K.

fields.question: Will 4K sports channels have content when there is not a live event on?
fields.answer: No. 4K channels will only show content when there is a 4K broadcast.

fields.question: Does streaming in 4K use more of my monthly Internet data?
fields.answer:
Yes, streaming 4K UHD content requires a great deal of internet bandwidth compared to HD to SD video.

It's estimated that 1 hour of 4K Ultra HD programming will account for up to 7 GB of bandwidth.

fields.question: What is the difference between 4K UHD HDR and 4K UHD SDR?
fields.answer: HDR stands for High Definition Range whereas SDR stands for Standard Definition Range. Both 4K formats require a 4K TV, but a HDR format will have better colour and contrast than SDR.

fields.question: What is 4K upscaling and what is native 4K?
fields.answer:
• Native means that the content is delivered in 4K resolution.
  • 4K upscaling means that content delivered in 1080p resolution is upscaled to 4K.
  • Upscaling is supported by some 4K TVs. This is a feature specific to your TV and is not controlled by Shaw.
  • Native 4K content is more detailed than upscaled 4K content.
  • Our 4K channels deliver native 4K content, when available.

title: Replay, pause and rewind
description: Find out how to replay, pause or rewind content on your TV.

fields.question: How do you replay TV?
fields.answer:
To replay a TV content:

  • You'll need to hit the Rec button on the bottom left of your remote. The TV box will then record the show from the point you started watching up until the end.
  • To replay that show, just hit the Recordings button on the remote and use the up and down navigation keys to highlight the recording you made. Press OK to replay that recording.
  • With TV you can also use the left navigation key on certain channels to view content on that channel from up to seven days ago. Just look for the Replay TV icon beside the channel name on your guide then use the left navigation key on your remote to view the last week's shows

Good to know: Not all content will be available to view via Replay TV due to broadcasting rights.

fields.question: How do you pause TV?
fields.answer: Press the Pause button at the very bottom of the remote at any time. This will hold the current show in place until you hit the Play button again.

fields.question: How do you rewind TV?
fields.answer:
Press the rewind arrow key at the bottom left of the remote. The box will rewind back through all the channels you've watched for the last three hours.

Good to know: This content will show your whole viewing history, so if you changed channels during the last few hours, the playback will also show you changing channels!

title: CEC function on TV remote control

fields.question: About TV input control (HDMI-CEC)
fields.answer:
This set-top box feature can help you avoid experiencing a “blank" screen, “no video” or "no signal" message on your TV. The TV input control automatically changes the input source to your TV set-top box when you press the STB button on your remote or set-top box.

Important:

  • Your set-up box must be connected to your TV via HDMI cable and your TV must support HDMI-CEC (Consumer Electronic Control) and be enabled
  • If you are using a different cable connection to your TV you will need to change to an HDMI cable, if your TV supports that input type

fields.question: How to enable the HDMI-CEC feature?
fields.answer:
When this feature is activated on both your TV and your set-top box, they will work together to display video from the same device and prevent encounters of a "blank" screen, "no signal" or “no video” message appearing on your TV.

This feature may have already been activated on your set-top box.

  • You can check if the feature is activated on your set-top boxes, by pressing the MENU button on the STB remote and then selecting Settings → Audio & Video → Video Settings → TV Input Control → Enable.
  • If a checkmark (√) appears next to Enable, the feature is activated on that set-top box and you will have the option of activating it on all of your set-top boxes at that time.

fields.question: How to activate the HDMI-CEC feature?
fields.answer:
Next, you must take the following steps to activate the feature on each TV:

  1. Make sure your set-top box is connected to your TV with an HDMI cable
  2. Use the remote that came with your TV (not the STB remote) to access the Settings menu on your TV
  3. Locate the TV input control HDMI-CEC feature.
    Note: This feature may use a different name depending on the manufacturer of your TV. Please visit their website for specific names or unique brand instructions.
  4. Enable or turn on the feature under Settings on your TV.
  5. Once enabled, on both your set-top box and TV, your STB remote will turn on the TV at the same time as the set-top box and ensure the video is displayed from your set-top box.

title: Record and delete TV content
description: Find out how to record shows from your TV or TV Guide, and delete recordings when you're done.

fields.question: To record
fields.answer:
To record while you're watching live TV, just hit the Rec button on the bottom left of the remote.

To record from the guide:

  1. Hit the Guide button on your remote
  2. Highlight the show you want to record by using the Up, Down, Left, and Right navigational keys
  3. Press the Rec button on the remote
  4. You'll be asked if you'd like to record just this episode or the entire season – select the option you'd like and press OK to begin the recording

fields.question: To delete
fields.answer:
To delete the recorded content:

  1. Press the Recordings button on the bottom right of your remote
  2. Select the show in your library and press OK
  3. Select the episode you want to delete, and press OK
  4. You will be asked if you'd like to delete just this episode or all episodes you have saved, select the option you'd like and press OK

fields.question: What is a CableCARD?
fields.answer: A CableCARD is a one-way PC card device that allows access to TV services. This means that you don’t need to lease a Receiver (cable box).

fields.question: How does a CableCARD work?
fields.answer: A CableCARD is installed into a compatible device, giving you access to TV services. This means you don’t need to lease a Receiver (cable box).

fields.question: What are the benefits of a CableCARD?
fields.answer:
1. Saving money. CableCARDs are the most affordable option for service equipment.
  2. Reduced clutter. Tired of all the wires and cords taking over your home? CableCARDs are wireless, so your TV stand will be free from messy cords and cables.
  3. Flexible DVR Options. CableCARDs let you pick your preferred DVR options, so you're not trapped with a DVR you don't like.

fields.question: How much do CableCARDs cost?
fields.answer: We lease CableCARDs for €2 per month for each separate card.

fields.question: How do I get a CableCARD?
fields.answer: CableCARDs must be leased from us, and can be self-installed or activated by our technician. Pick up your CableCARD at our store or have it delivered to your home. CableCARD-compatible devices can also be purchased at retail stores.

fields.question: Which devices are compatible with a CableCARD?
fields.answer:
CableCARDs work with many devices, including those manufactured by TiVo, Ceton, Silicon Dust, Samsung, etc.

Note: Contact your device manufacturer to check that your model will work with a CableCARD and that you have the required software needed for compatibility.

fields.question: On Demand Content
fields.answer:
CableCARDS do not support the following On Demand content:

  • Pay-Per-View
  • Video On Demand
  • iTV
  • Interactive Program Guides

title: Mobile
description: Instructions, troubleshooting tips and guided flows powered by digital agents

fields.question: What are PIN & PUK code?
fields.answer:
What is a PIN code?

  • Your PIN code gives access to your handset. You have to give it in every time you start your phone. When you buy a new SIM card, you receive a PIN code which you can change later.
  • Good to know: you get 3 attempts to give in the right PIN code. 3 times wrong? Then your handset will block itself as a security mechanism. If this happens, you need your PUK code to unblock it.

What is a PUK code?

  • Your PUK code comes in handy when your handset is blocked (for any reason). The PUK code typically counts more digits than the PIN code.

fields.question: What does this message: ‘SIM card rejected’ mean?
fields.answer:
Remove your SIM card from your phone for a moment and then put it back in it.

Same problem? Perhaps you already entered an incorrect PUK code 10 times? Then you will get the message 'SIM card rejected'. In this case, it means that we have locked your SIM card in order to protect your phone and your personal data. This also means that your SIM card is not usable anymore.

fields.question: Why my device is showing ‘No SIM’?
fields.answer:
If you've added a SIM card to your device and you’re seeing this message, you can try one or all of the following:

  • Restart your device
  • Take your SIM card out, wipe with a clean, dry cloth and re-insert it
  • Try the SIM card in another device to ensure it’s the card and not the device that’s faulty
  • Ensure your device is not locked to a non-Vodafone network. If your phone is locked, you'll need to contact your current network provider to get it unlocked.
  • If you’ve recently activated a replacement SIM, your old SIM will stop working. Try your new SIM card instead.

fields.question: What size SIM card do I need?
fields.answer:
There are three SIM sizes – the one you need depends on your device:

  • Standard SIM – most non-smartphones
  • MicroSIM – smartphones like the iPhone 4
  • NanoSIM – the smallest SIM, used in the latest phones

We use multi-SIM cards – just take out the size you need. Your phone's user guide will tell you which size to use and how to insert it.

fields.question: How to insert the SIM card?
fields.answer:
Once you’ve received confirmation your old number has been transferred to us, you can insert your SIM into the phone you want to use. If you are getting a new number, insert it straight away.

There are three SIM sizes: standard, micro, and nano. Most recent devices use nano. We'll send you a triple SIM, so you just need to pop out the right-sized SIM for your device.

STEP 1. Locate the SIM-card slot

  • Remove your current SIM (or open your device) ready to insert the new SIM. Make sure your phone is turned off first.
  • The SIM slot is typically found on the edge of your phone or behind the battery cover (if it is removable). If you aren’t sure, check your manufacturer’s user guide.
  • For some phones, you will need to use a tool to get the SIM tray out, which you insert into a small hole next to the SIM-card slot and the tray should pop out.
  • These tools are usually found in the box, but if you misplace yours, you can use an earring or small paperclip.

STEP 2. Select the correct SIM

  • Pop out the SIM you need from the triple SIM. You should be able to tell what size you need by looking at your previous SIM card or SIM holder.
  • If you pop out the wrong-sized SIM, you can usually still use it – simply break out the correct size and place your smaller SIM back.

STEP 3. Pop the SIM into your device.

  • Turn on your phone and you are ready for the next step.
  • SIM cards can contain personal information such as contacts, so you can either keep your old SIM card or it cut up and throw it away.

fields.question: What about dual SIM?
fields.answer:
A dual SIM smartphone can support two SIM cards. Whether it’s two physical SIM card slots or eSIM technology, here’s everything you need to know about dual SIM.

What is a dual SIM?

Mobile phones require a SIM card to connect to a mobile network. Dual SIM is when a mobile phone has the option to use two SIM cards on a single device.

There are two ways a mobile phone can support dual SIMs:

  1. Dual physical SIMs - a phone that has two physical SIM card slots
  2. eSIM - a phone that has one physical SIM card slot, and one eSIM built into the device

A mobile phone with dual SIM cards allows the user to standby on two separate mobile networks. This means you’re able to make and receive phone calls and SMS from two different phone numbers, on a single mobile device. You can also use mobile data from the two different networks, however, you may only use the internet on one network at a time.


What is the difference between dual SIM and eSIM technology?

An eSIM is an electronic or embedded SIM card that’s built directly into a mobile phone. A mobile phone with eSIM capabilities also has one physical SIM card slot. This means you’re able to use two different mobile networks; one using the physical SIM slot and one using the eSIM.

  • What is the advantage of a dual SIM phone?

Having the ability to use two different mobile networks on the same mobile device is useful in several situations.

  1. One phone for work and personal use. The benefit of using a dual SIM mobile phone is that you’re able to make and receive calls and SMS from both your personal and work phone, all on one device, rather than having to carry around two separate mobile phones.
  2. International travel. Dual SIM means you can take advantage of local plans while traveling overseas. You can insert a local SIM into one of the SIM card slots to use for making calls and using data. At the same time, you can keep your Australian SIM in the other card slot, so that you remain available for incoming calls and SMS to your personal number.
  3. Getting the best deal. Dual SIM means you can take advantage of the best mobile plans to suit your needs. Because you can only use one of the SIMs for mobile data at a time, you can pick a plan with an appropriate data allowance for this SIM. You can then use the other SIM card slot for calls and text, without having to worry about the amount of data allowance on that plan.
  4. How can I use mobile data in a dual SIM phone?

While you can make and receive calls and SMS from either SIM card in dual SIM phones, you can only have one active data connection to the internet. In the Settings section of your phone, you are required to set your preferred SIM for connecting to the Internet.


How do I know if my phone is dual SIM?

There are a number of ways you can check if your phone is dual SIM:

  1. Open the SIM card settings on your device and see if there are two options
  2. Check the phone package for two IMEI numbers

Can I use one SIM card in a dual SIM phone?

Yes. You can use just one single SIM card in a dual SIM phone. The second SIM card slot simply gives you the option to use a second SIM card if you would like.

How to set up call forwarding in a dual SIM phone

When a phone is in Dual SIM Dual Standby mode, and one SIM is engaged in a call, you will miss any incoming calls from the other SIM that occur during the time that that first SIM is engaged.
To overcome this issue, you can set up call forwarding between the two SIMs.

How do I activate dual SIM?

If your phone is single SIM it cannot be converted into a dual SIM phone.
If your phone is dual SIM, you can activate it by inserting two SIM cards – one in the first SIM card slot, and a second SIM card in the second SIM card slot. The activation settings for dual SIM can be accessed in your phone’s settings.


How do I turn one SIM off on a dual SIM phone?

You can turn off one SIM card in the settings section of your phone. The settings options may vary between devices. If you do not wish to use a second SIM card, you could also remove the second SIM from the SIM card slot.

fields.question: What should I do if I can’t make or receive calls or texts?
fields.answer:
First, you should try to:

  • Turn your phone off and on again
  • Test out different phone numbers – in case you’re trying to call or text an invalid number


If neither of those work, here are some of the most common issues.

  • Check your payment details or credit amount
    • If you’re on a Pay monthly plan, check that your payment details are correct and all your payments have been made. If you’ve missed one or more payments, we might have restricted your service
  • Find out how to pay your bill
    • If you’re on one of our Pay as you go bundles or our Pay as you go 1 plan, you’ll have unlimited calls and texts. However, if you’re on one of our older plans, you may have run out of credit or used all your allowances.
  • Check you’ve got signal
    • Make sure you don't have airplane or flight mode switched on – check your device settings.
    • There could be coverage issues due to a network fault in your area. Check for any faults using our network status checker
    • If there are currently any faults or ongoing maintenance in your area, you might be able to use Wi-Fi Calling
  • Turn off roaming bars
    • If you’re abroad, you could have an active roaming bar on your account. If you have access to local Wi-Fi, you can check and remove bars

fields.question: I can’t send an SMS
fields.answer:
If you can’t send an SMS:

  • Some phones' SMS memory can become full, which will stop you from sending and receiving SMSs. You should clear the inbox, outbox, and sent items and power off the handset
  • Double-check that you have the correct number
  • The message may be converted from SMS to MMS. An SMS message can be converted into an MMS message on Samsung and Android devices in general, this happens because:
    1. The SMS is going to more than one recipient
    2. The message is too long
    3. There are pictures in the message

To disable and prevent this, from the messaging app go to Settings and locate and unselect Group Messaging for MMS settings

fields.question: 4G Calling (VoLTE)
fields.answer:
What is 4G Calling (VoLTE)?

4G Calling, also known as Voice over Long Term Evolution (VoLTE) enables you to make calls and stay connected to the 4G network. VoLTE calls have the superior audio quality to regular phone calls made over the standard voice network. VoLTE lets you talk and use LTE data simultaneously, and conduct up to six-way conference calls.

What are the benefits of VoLTE?

  • Superfast speeds – calls on VoLTE will connect quicker than before
  • Enhanced call quality – HD voice quality when using VoLTE
  • Seamless coverage – switch between Wi-Fi Calling at home and VoLTE on the move, maintaining HD voice quality at all times.
  • Multi-tasking - flick between apps while on a call
  • Web Browsing – allow for internet browsing while on a call


Is there a charge for using VoLTE?

VoLTE is included at no additional charge. You can make and receive VoLTE calls with other users, as long as they’re in supported locations, with supported devices and VoLTE capabilities turned on.

title: My phone has been lost or stolen
description: If you've lost your mobile or had it stolen, don't panic. We'll help you get back up and running as soon as we can.

fields.question: I've lost my mobile or had it stolen. What do I do?
fields.answer:
What to do when a phone has been stolen:

  1. Please contact us
    1. First, we'll bar your SIM card. This will make sure that no one can make calls, send texts or use data using your number. Then we'll blacklist your phone so no one can use it.
    2. If your phone has been stolen you need to tell the police and get a crime reference number. You'll need this if you want to put in an insurance claim.
    3. Then order a replacement SIM. You can ask us for one when you report the theft, or do it online any time.
  2. Order a replacement SIM
    1. Your new SIM will take 1-2 business days to get to you. You'll need to activate it before you can use it.
  3. Activate your replacement SIM
    1. Your mobile number will stay the same.

fields.question: I've found my phone. Can I just start using it again?
fields.answer:
If you've got us to bar your SIM, but haven't yet ordered a replacement, then yes. Just give us a call and we'll unbar it. You'll also need to ask us to un-blacklist your phone.

If you get your phone back and you've already ordered another SIM, you'll need to wait for the new one to arrive and then activate it. Your old SIM won't work anymore. But we can still un-blacklist your phone if you contact us.

fields.question: Managing unauthorized charges
fields.answer:
What if my bill shows unauthorized charges because my device was lost or stolen?

  • If your bill shows charges to your device after it was lost but before you reported it, and you want credit for those charges, contact us and we'll investigate your account activity.
  • You don't have to pay the charges in question while they're being investigated. 
  • Also, we'll give you a courtesy suspension of recurring monthly fees for up to 30 days, if you haven't received one within the prior year.

If my phone is missing for several days before I notice it's missing, how will I be able to show that the person using it wasn't authorized to do so?

  • We'll take all facts and circumstances into consideration. In addition, we'll review your account, and compare the usage during the time that the phone was missing to the time when the phone was in your possession. 
  • If the phone was used to contact entirely different phone numbers, this may indicate to us that the phone was being used by someone not authorized to do so.
  • We'll consider all relevant information when deciding your claim, including any documentation you can provide that shows the phone wasn't in your possession at the time of the calls.

I reported unauthorized charges made on my account. How long will it take for you to complete your investigation and resolve the issue?

  • We'll try to resolve any dispute regarding unauthorized charges within 30 days. You're not required to pay the disputed amount while our investigation is pending.

title: Roaming
description: Find out how to keep using your mobile when you leave the country.

fields.question: Can you roam abroad with your Mobile plan?
fields.answer: Yes. You can use your phone wherever you are in the world. But remember, roaming rates will apply while roaming outside of the EU. Inside the EU you can use your Mobile allowance, subject to a fair usage policy, without any extra charge. You don't need to activate roaming on your Mobile Plan, but you may need to activate data roaming on your phone settings to access the mobile internet while abroad.

fields.question: What can you do if you have no mobile network connection abroad?
fields.answer:
When you’ve just arrived abroad, it’s time to get roaming with these handy tips.

  • First, switch your phone off and on again to kick-start your roaming connection. Switching airplane mode off and on won’t do this, so make sure you power off fully for best results.
  • Your phone will then automatically search for an available network. This can take up to 10 minutes as it searches through all of the 2G, 3G, and 4G bands for each network to find the right one for you.
  • If your mobile phone doesn’t connect automatically, try selecting a network manually. Your phone will give you a few options to choose from.
  • Still have trouble connecting? Contact our customer support team and we’ll help get you sorted.

Using Mobile Data

If you want to use data when abroad you may need to activate data roaming when you land (this should be set to “On” even when at home to get optimum coverage). Here’s how to do this :

  • Android: Apps → Settings → Connections → Data Usage → Enable mobile data
  • Apple: Settings → Mobile Data → Enable Mobile Data

In some cases, you may need to manually enter the APN (Access Point Names). The APN is the gateway for the phone to talk to the data part of the mobile network. The majority of phones should automatically choose the correct APN but if they do not you can manually enter the APN which is “Internet”. Details on how to do this can be found in your phone’s user manual.

fields.question: How to use less data when abroad?
fields.answer:
Turn off mobile data

  • We suggest switching data off manually from your phone's settings when you're not using it. Apps can use data in the background, so by doing this it'll help reduce the risk of your phone using data without your knowledge.
  • Note: Make sure data is also switched off when connecting to Wi-Fi.


Restricting data usage on apps

  • If you wish to have data on but only want to use some apps, you can turn mobile data off manually for apps you don't need when roaming. This will help reduce the chance of an app using data in the background.
  • Note: You'll be able to use the apps when you're connected to Wi-Fi.


Turn off Automatic Update/Sync

  • We also suggest you switch off automatic updates and syncing, such as iCloud, Google photos and software updates, etc., as this can use large amounts of data in the background without your knowledge.


Put watching videos or streaming music on hold

  • Streaming videos or music will consume lots of data. Make sure that you're on a Wi-Fi network if you want to watch videos or stream music on your phone. Or download your playlists/movies before you go!


Connect to Wi-Fi

  • To help reduce data usage, try connecting your phone, tablet, or laptop to an available Wi-Fi network when overseas. Many hotels, restaurants, and airports offer free Wi-Fi, so be on the lookout. Remember to switch off mobile data while connecting to Wi-Fi.


Monitor your usage

  • It's important to monitor your usage when roaming to help avoid any excess charges.

fields.question: What can impact your Mobile coverage and availability?
fields.answer:
Geography

  • A mobile network is made up of cell towers throughout the country. These are tall structures with antennas that broadcast and receive mobile signals. They need to be in locations that are not obscured by buildings, mountains, or forests. The further a customer is away from a cell tower, the lower the data service connection will be. This can mean lower speeds and inconsistent service.
  • Service can also be affected in hilly or mountainous areas. A mobile phone signal can get worse as it progresses across hills or mountains, or if the user is in the shadow of a hill with the mast on the far side. This means you may need to move around to improve performance.


Buildings

  • Building insulation can affect your services and speeds when using your mobile inside. This applies to both commercial and domestic buildings. There may be indoor areas where you don’t have access to all services or where coverage is limited. You might need to change your location within the building or go outdoors to improve performance.


Lots of users

  • High usage in your area might cause data speeds to get worse, or make it impossible to send a text or make calls. This could be during morning and evening rush hours, or at events or gigs where thousands of people are nearby. Calls to emergency services are not affected by this.


Your device

  • We offer services across 2G, 3G, and 4G, but not all devices support all standards. For example, if your mobile phone does not support 4G, you will not be able to achieve 4G speeds. Also, the performance of your service may be affected by having pending software updates on your smartphone or if the storage on the device is full.


Applications used

  • Different applications need different speeds from a network to work properly. Sending or receiving emails can be done with lower speeds but uploading or downloading video needs more. The less speed an application needs, the less likely it is to be interrupted by network congestion or poor coverage.


Wi-Fi

  • Mobile phones can use nearby Wi-Fi instead of the operator’s network. Once registered, users may not realize they’re using Wi-Fi instead of the mobile network. Wi-Fi performance may not be as consistent as that offered by the operator’s network. You can switch from Wi-Fi to your mobile network in your device’s settings.


Call quality

  • Your call quality can vary because of the factors above. Sometimes, a call may drop due to moving to, or being somewhere with poor coverage, for example, the basement of a building or a remote forest. Dropped calls can also be caused by issues on the other end of a call.

fields.question: I have a reception problem on my mobile phone. What can I do?
fields.answer:
Our network reaches 98% of our country's population, but we cannot guarantee that the network will always function flawlessly everywhere. Sometimes a temporary situation (e.g. work to improve the network, certain weather conditions) can disrupt the good reception.

Various factors can influence the network quality:

  • At home or outdoors: the reception is always better outside.
  • Mobile phone/smartphone: not every device offers the same reception capacity.
  • Peak times: when the network is overloaded, the quality decreases.
  • Distance from the cell tower: the closer you are to the cell tower, the better the reception.
  • Weather: the network may be temporally disrupted during lightning storms or heavy snowfall.


Still have issues? Our technical service staff does all they can to solve your problem quickly and correctly. To do this, they need some specific information.

  • What are you having problems with? Calling, texting, or browsing?
  • Describe the problem and the error message you see (on the screen or during a call).
  • Does this happen often, or just now and then?
  • When did you have this problem?
  • Where do you have this problem? Do you experience the problem at various locations or just in one particular location?
  • Are you indoors, outdoors, or on the move (car/train/bus)?
  • Which brand and type of handset do you use?
  • What is the best way for us to reach you?

fields.question: What does the ‘network busy’ error message mean?
fields.answer:
If you get a 'network busy' error message, this means there’s a high volume of use on the network. A typical reason could be that there’s a major event going on in your area, perhaps a concert or a football match.

It should be a short-term problem, but you may want to try one of the following:

  • Try turning your phone off and on again to pick up the strongest local signal
  • You could also try our Mobile Coverage and Network Checker to see if there’s a known issue or to report a problem

fields.question: About data charges
fields.answer:
Data is charged in two ways; it is either included in your plan or you are charged by what you use. You may have a certain amount of data included in your plan and if you go over this you will be charged the daily rate.

Watching videos or listening to music on your phone can eat into your data allowances quickly. It is best to access video-based sources (such as Netflix and music/radio streaming) over Wi-Fi to ensure you won't be charged.

fields.question: About usage warning
fields.answer: To help prevent you from going over your data allowance, you will get a warning text when you’re at 80% and again at 100%.

fields.question: How much data do I need?
fields.answer:
How much data you need depends on your smartphone and internet usage. What does your mobile internet usage 'cost' without Wi-Fi?

  • Sending emails and downloading a maximum of 100 web pages per day: < 200 MB
  • Sending emails, downloading apps and viewing images: 200 MB – 1 GB
  • Streaming video (1 GB = 10 minutes/day); streaming music (1 GB = 30 minutes/day); downloading or uploading images (1 GB = 10 minutes/day): < 2 GB
  • Tethering (using a smartphone as a mobile hotspot) with a tablet, streaming longer video/music content or uploading and downloading images: > 2 GB

title: Mobile hotspot
description: Learn to use the Mobile Hotspot feature or app on your smartphone or tablet to connect devices to the internet, using your current plan’s data.

fields.question: What is a Mobile Hotspot feature or app?
fields.answer:
A Mobile Hotspot lets you share your network connection with other devices so they can access the internet. Devices connect to your Mobile Hotspot using Wi-Fi. While devices are connected, you're charged for any data they use according to your monthly data plan.

Many smartphones and tablets have a built-in Mobile Hotspot feature that you can access in your device's Settings or the App menu.

fields.question: Will I be charged to use my Mobile Hotspot feature or app?
fields.answer: When a device is connected to your phone’s Mobile Hotspot feature or app, data usage is applied to your data plan's monthly allowance.

fields.question: Which mobile devices are compatible with Mobile Hotspot?
fields.answer: All of our currently available smartphones are compatible with Mobile Hotspot features or apps. If you have an older device, refer to the User Guide of your device to be sure Mobile Hotspot is compatible.

fields.question: Do I need to download Mobile Hotspot to my device?
fields.answer: No, Mobile Hotspot comes preinstalled on compatible devices. Depending on your device, it may be in your device's App menu or Settings.

fields.question: How many devices can be connected to Mobile Hotspot at the same time?
fields.answer:
Some devices with a Mobile Hotspot feature or app allow up to 10 devices to connect at a time, while others allow a maximum of 5.
Refer to the User Guide of your device to see how many devices can be connected to your specific device.

fields.question: How do I connect a device to my Mobile Hotspot on my phone or tablet?
fields.answer:
You connect to Mobile Hotspot on your phone or tablet the same way you'd connect to any Wi-Fi network:

  1. 1. Open your Wi-Fi settings on the device you want to connect to Mobile Hotspot, and scan for available networks. Your Mobile Hotspot name (SSID) should appear in the list.
  2. 2. In the list of available Wi-Fi networks, select the name of the Mobile Hotspot.
  3. 3. If requested, enter the Mobile Hotspot password.
  4. Tap Join or Connect.

You've successfully connected a device to your Mobile Hotspot.

fields.question: What is the Hide SSID option in my Mobile Hotspot settings?
fields.answer: The SSID is the unique name of your Mobile Hotspot feature or app that people see when scanning for available Wi-Fi networks. When you turn on the Hide SSID option, your Mobile Hotspot can't be seen by nearby Wi-Fi devices.

fields.question: What is 4G?
fields.answer: 4G is a mobile network that allows high-speed wireless internet access.

fields.question: What do I need to use 4G?
fields.answer:
You'll need:

  • A4G phone, tablet, or mobile broadband device
  • A pay monthly / SIM only plan or pay as you go pack

fields.question: Can I connect to 4G with a 3G device?
fields.answer: No, you'll need a 4G device to connect to our 4G network.

fields.question: Can I buy a 4G device elsewhere and connect to 4G on your network?
fields.answer: Yes, if you buy an unlocked 4G device from someone else, you'll be able to connect to our 4G network with a SIM-only plan or using a pay-as-you-go pack.

fields.question: How do I check 4G coverage in my area?
fields.answer: You can check 4G coverage in your area by visiting our Mobile Coverage and Network Checker.

fields.question: Can I use 4G abroad (roaming)?
fields.answer:
You can connect to 4G networks if they’re available in other countries. You won’t be charged extra if you connect and use 4G in most European countries, including all EU countries. You’ll use your normal data allowance.

Outside these countries the price of using 4G depends on:

  • What country you’re in
  • The plan that you’re on

fields.question: Can I upgrade from a 4G plan to a 5G plan?
fields.answer: Yes, you can upgrade to one of our pay monthly or SIM only 5G Smart plans but you'll need to have a 5G device and have 5G coverage to connect to our 5G network.

title: 5G
description: You can experience the latest generation of mobile technology with our 5G plans and devices. We offer 5G service, vastly improving the way customers stream content, play games, navigate and make video calls.

fields.question: What is 5G?
fields.answer:
5G is the fifth generation of our global mobile networking standard. This new technology provides the infrastructure to shape the digital transformation of the future as it favors cloud computing, integration & interoperability of connected devices. Smart cities and a digital society will only be truly possible through the deployment of 5G.

It has:

  • Higher speeds – download music, movies, and more in seconds, with speeds of up to 200Mbps
  • Lower latency – no interruptions with quick response times making lag a thing of the past
  • Greater capacity – no competing for signal even in busy places

fields.question: What are the benefits of 5G?
fields.answer:
With 5G, you will surf even faster than today! Eventually, it will allow you to surf at a speed up to 10 times faster than existing 4G networks while experiencing significant improvements in latency, which will allow you to benefit from an even more responsive mobile network and applications.

Every day, more data is consumed (for video, music, gaming, calls, etc.) and more and more devices (smartphones, tablets, sensors, video cameras, wearables, connected devices, connected cars, etc.) are connected simultaneously. 5G is the solution for the future that supports an even larger number of devices without any loss of quality and with better reliability. 5G is also more green because it uses less energy per data transmitted.

Now, all these benefits will not come at once. We have now started to progressively adapt our network to be able to offer all the benefits 5G will bring, and it will certainly take several years to achieve all those benefits, similarly as it did for the development of previous technologies.

fields.question: Is 5G safe?
fields.answer:
Yes, based on research carried out by major international bodies such as the World Health Organization.

5G frequencies are covered by safety guidelines that are based on extensive research carried out over many years. These guidelines apply to 5G as they do to 2G, 3G, and 4G technologies, as well as other radio frequencies used for radio and TV.

The World Health Organization has concluded that there are no adverse health effects to 5G exposure at levels under the safety guidelines.

We place the safety of our customers at the heart of what we do and fully comply with all national and international safety guidelines in all markets.

fields.question: What's the difference between 4G and 5G?
fields.answer:
5G is the next generation of mobile technology and gives faster speeds, less buffering, and more reliability than 4G.

5G speeds are around five times faster than 4G. This means you could download a full HD movie in as little as three minutes.

Latency, or lag, is much lower – down from an average of 75 milliseconds on 4G, to around 8 milliseconds on 5G.

5G has more bandwidth than 4G which means there's more capacity to use data. So if you're in a crowded area, there's much less struggle to get a signal with 5G.

fields.question: What do I need to connect to 5G?
fields.answer:
You will need:

  • 5G network on your mobile: check out the network coverage map.
  • A device that is compatible with the 5G network
  • A 5G mobile plan: check out our mobile plans for private or business customers.

fields.question: I have a 5G device, why am I not getting 5G speeds?
fields.answer:
If you're using a 5G device and are not getting 5G speeds, it's possible you're not in a 5G coverage area, or there is heavy network congestion. When your device is connected to 5G service, a 5G icon will display on your phone.

Note: You'll only see the 5G icon when you're actively using data. If your device is using Wi-Fi, this icon won't be visible.

title: How-Tos and FAQs
description: Learn how to stop unwanted and annoying calls, how to manage incoming calls with voicemail and more...

title: Call features and services
description: Learn about the different features available on your home phone like call forwarding, call waiting and voicemail.

title: Call forwarding faqs
description: Find out the benefits of call forwarding and how to set it up.

fields.question: What is call forwarding?
fields.answer: Call forwarding allows you to forward all incoming calls to another phone number that you choose. This can be another landline number or a mobile.

fields.question: Is there a charge to set up call forwarding?
fields.answer: No, there's no set-up charge.

fields.question: How do you set up call forwarding?
fields.answer:
1. Dial *70 into your phone's dial pad
  2. Enter the number you wish to forward the calls to
  3. Then press the Call button on your phone
  4. Wait a few moments for confirmation that it's gone through

fields.question: How do you turn off call forwarding?
fields.answer: Pick up your phone and dial #70 followed by the call button. Wait five to six seconds and hang up.

fields.question: How much does call forwarding cost?
fields.answer:
There’s no set-up charge, but any calls that are forwarded are charged at standard call rates.

If you forward your calls to a mobile number, the person calling you pays the standard cost of calling your landline number. You will pay for the call from your landline to your mobile.

fields.question: Reject anonymous or private calls
fields.answer: This home phone feature helps you reject numbers you don't recognize.

fields.question: What is anonymous call rejection?
fields.answer:
This feature lets you reject incoming calls that come in as: Private, Withheld or No caller ID on your phone.

When this feature is active, all of your incoming calls will be checked before they are allowed to connect to you and the ones above will be rejected.

fields.question: How do you activate anonymous call rejection?
fields.answer: Dial: *90 from your home phone.

fields.question: How do you deactivate anonymous call rejection?
fields.answer: Dial #90 from your home phone.

fields.question: What is call barring and why would you want it?
fields.answer:
Call barring is a feature on your home phone that restricts certain types of outgoing calls. International calls and premium rate calls can cost a lot - so it helps you save money!

For example, calls to utility companies are often charged at premium rates - but the cost is not always clear. Activating call barring for premium numbers will stop this happening.

fields.question: Is there any setup fee?
fields.answer: No, there is no setup fee.

fields.question: How much does it cost to use call barring?
fields.answer:
You'll pay monthly for the service. It costs:

  • Mobile call barring: €3.36 per month
  • Mobile and premium call barring: €3.36 per month
  • All other call barring: €3.00 per month

fields.question: How do you set up call barring?
fields.answer: Give our customer service team a call or start a chat with us and we can take it from there.

title: Account management
description: Information, guidance and tools to manage your account, limits and orders
keywords: account upgrade top up prepaid tariff

title: My Account
description: Get information and manage your account and tariff plans

title: Manage my account data and contract information
description: This digital agent can manage your account data, as well as get you information about your contracts

title: TOOL Change my account details
description: Tool enabling various checks and changes related to account and contract.     Q: Do I have a contractual obligation?  Q: I have a new ID, can I change my contract information accordingly?  Q: I want to change the user of the line that is in my name. How can I do that? Q: How do I change my name, address? Q: How can I manage my spending limit? Q: Can I get my PUK number?  Q: Can I get a new SIM?

title: Manage my contract details
description: Learn more about how to manage your contract details.

fields.question: Where can I find my Account information?
fields.answer: You can find them on your bill. Account information can include any personal information that directly relates to an account. This can include account numbers, telephone numbers, mailing addresses, email addresses, etc.

fields.question: What is my Account number and where can I find it?
fields.answer: Numbers, letters, or alphanumeric codes assigned to every customer are used to identify existing service accounts. This number can be found on the upper right portion of your bill that identifies you and your billing telephone number.

fields.question: How can I activate my e-bill service?
fields.answer: Send an SMS with the e-mail address to which you want to receive the invoice on the number 123456, and your e-invoice will be available via e-mail.

fields.question: I want to buy the device in installments. Do I have to sign a contractual obligation?
fields.answer: Yes. Repayment of the device in installments is only possible with a contractual obligation.

fields.question: How many times per year can I buy a new device?
fields.answer: As many as you like. But if you purchased one and used an installment plan to pay it, then you can buy a new one after you repay the previously purchased device.

fields.question: What payment options do you offer?
fields.answer:
You have the following payment options in the Telecom online shop:

  • Cash on delivery
  • Credit card
  • PayPal - for selected products

fields.question: Until when can I withdraw from my online purchase?
fields.answer:
If you have ordered from the Telecom online shop, you can return the purchased items to us within 14 days.

Repayment

When paying by credit card, the repayment will be processed directly by the credit card company.

If you pay cash on delivery, you will receive the purchase price back by postal order.

The repayment or chargeback of Telecom points takes about 2 to 3 weeks.

title: Terms and conditions
description: Everything you need to know about terms and conditions

fields.question: Introduction
fields.answer:
These terms and conditions of Telecom service provider ("Terms of Use") are between Telcom service provider and its affiliates (individually and collectively "Telecom") and apply to all users, viewers and all people who have access to Telecom's web sites located at Telecom.

By using and viewing Telecom's web sites, you agree to these Terms of Use. If you do not agree, do not use Telecom's web sites. Any access or use of Telecom's web sites is undertaken at your own risk.

Telecom reserves the right to revise these Terms of Use or other terms and conditions relating to Telecom's web sites and you should note that Telecom may modify or amend these Terms of Use at any time, with or without notice to you by posting a copy of the modified or amended Terms of Use on Telecom's websites becoming effective immediately upon posting of the revised Terms of Use on Telecom's web sites.

You agree to the modified or amended Terms of Use and if you continue using Telecom's web sites following the date they are posted you are bound by such revisions and therefore you should periodically visit the Telecom "terms and conditions" web page to review the current Terms of Use and terms and conditions which you are bound.

fields.question: Contents of Site and Intellectual Property
fields.answer:
All content on Telecom's web sites, including the text, graphics, interfaces, photographs, images, trademarks, logos, artwork, designs, layout, structure, expression, "look and feel" and arrangement of the content on Telecom's web site, is owned, controlled or licensed by Telecom.

All content contained on Telecom's web sites is, to the fullest extent possible, copyrighted and otherwise proprietary, and is protected by copyright, patent and trademark laws, and various other intellectual property laws.

No right, title or interest in any of Telecom's intellectual property are transferred to you by use of or access to Telecom's web sites and you may not make any use of Telecom's intellectual property, except as permitted under the Terms of Use. Telecom's reserves all rights to Telecom's site.

fields.question: Restrictions on Use
fields.answer:
Telecom's web sites and services are solely intended for your personal, non- commercial use only. You may download and use the contents of Telecom's web sites for personal use only on these Terms of Use. Otherwise, Telecom's web sites and contents may not be copied, reproduced, distributed, republished, reproduced, uploaded, posted, transmitted in any way or otherwise dealt with without the prior written consent of Telecom. You may not misuse Telecom's web sites (including without limitation, by hacking). You are prohibited from posting or transmitting on Telecom's web sites, forums, bulletin boards or Telecom's other products and services any material:

  • that is threatening, defamatory, obscene, indecent, offensive, pornographic, abusive, liable to racial hatred, discriminatory, menacing, scandalous, inflammatory, blasphemous, in breach of confidence, in breach of privacy or which may cause annoyance or inconvenience;
  • for which you have not obtained all necessary licences, consents, approvals, and/or authorisations;
  • which constitutes or encourages conduct that would be considered a criminal offence, give rise to civil liability, or otherwise be contrary to law of or infringe the rights of any third party, in any country in the world; or
  • that is technically harmful (including, but not limited to, computer viruses, logic bombs, Trojan horses, worms, harmful components, corrupted data or other malicious software or harmful data).

fields.question: Linking
fields.answer:
Telecom's web sites may contain third party information and links to third party web sites. Wherever practical, in our opinion, such third party information is marked accordingly. Links to third party web sites via Telecom's web site are solely for your convenience. fields.question: I am travelling abroad - what do I have to do before going on a trip?
fields.answer:
Follow this checklist before going on a trip:

  1. Check that these most important numbers in the address book are written in the international format, containing the country code. You will not be able to call numbers entered without the country code from abroad.
  2. If you use Voice Mail, listen to all messages. Listening to messages on the Roaming Secretary is charged as an outgoing roaming call.
  3. Check which operators are available in the country you are traveling to in the always-updated roaming partner network table. The good news is that there are Vodafone partner networks among them because connecting to their networks will ensure the lowest costs for sure!
  4. When someone calls you / sends an SMS, the call / SMS will be forwarded to your mobile device, no matter where you are (the caller does not have to know where you are). An incoming call will be charged when you receive a call. Received SMS will not be charged.
  5. You want to use the Internet abroad, but you are worried about high costs? Control costs with the Limit of data consumption abroad.
  6. Check if your charger can work in the electrical network of your destination. On our webshop and other points of sale, we have a wide selection of power adapters and other accessories.

fields.question: I am travelling abroad - what will happen when I reach my destination?
fields.answer:
When you arrive in another country, your phone will automatically connect to one of the available networks in your area. If you have selected Manual mobile network selection, the device will not connect to the mobile network but you must select the network yourself.

When connecting to the network of a foreign operator, you will receive an SMS with price information from the SMS roaming price list service. The prices in the SMS message are shown in accordance with the price list of the basic roaming price list with the tariff model or roaming service that users have included on their subscriber line.

fields.question: What is an additional roaming charge?
fields.answer:
There are two types of additional Roaming charges.

First: The use of domestic prices in EU / EEA Roaming is intended for occasional travel, not for longer stays and predominant consumption abroad. When you use the domestic tariff more in Roaming than within the country, we will send you SMS alerts. If, after 15 days of this SMS, Roaming consumption is still higher than domestic consumption, we will send you an SMS notifying you of the start of charging an additional fee.

Second: When you spend a certain number of MB from your tariff (you reach the spending threshold in Roaming), you can still spend the remaining MB, but an additional fee will start to be charged. If you reach the spending threshold defined for your tariff in Roaming, we will send you an SMS to start charging this additional fee.

fields.question: What is the difference between roaming and international calls?
fields.answer:
International calls are calls you make to international numbers (landline or mobile) while in your country and do not refer to calls made to another domestic number, even if it is abroad.

Roaming calls are all calls you make while abroad, regardless of the number you call.

fields.question: Why should I bundle my services?
fields.answer: You can connect existing services with a new service or completely new services. By connecting services at your request, depending on the related services, you get benefits on a monthly fee for related services, and you receive one bill for bundled services. If you have a contractual obligation with another operator, you can connect this service later.

fields.question: In which case am I charged a tariff change?
fields.answer: There is no charge for changing tariffs on new tariffs. You can change the tariff free of charge whenever you want, and you can activate another of the new tariffs.

fields.question: Can I downgrade my phone plan?
fields.answer: If you're on a contract-free plan, or if your old contract has run its course, you're free to change the plan. You can get a more affordable plan with your current provider or shop around for a better deal without paying any termination fees. At most, you'll need to pay out your final month

fields.question: What happens when mobile phone contract ends?
fields.answer: Remember, when your contract ends, it means you've paid off your handset and it belongs to you. This gives you the flexibility to choose a sim only, or a pay-as-you-go deal

fields.question: Why postpaid is more expensive than prepaid?
fields.answer: Postpaid plans are marginally more expensive than Prepaid plans, but they are more successful and provide more user advantages. Postpaid packages cannot be canceled easily and have no end date. Even though at the end of each month, if you do not pay the bill on time, your telecom will prolong the time period slightly

fields.answer:

fields.question: I won't need the service for a while. Can I turn it off temporarily?
fields.answer:
Yes, you can. Depending on which service you use, the terms will also vary.

If you use mobile subscription services, Homebox, or Officebox services, you can temporarily switch off your service for a maximum of 92 days, and if you use Telecom's fixed network, Internet and TV, or satellite TV, you can temporarily switch off these services for a maximum of 6 months.

The price for this service is:

  • for mobile subscription services, Homebox and Officebox 10 GBP
  • for fixed-line telephone, Internet, TV, and satellite TV 11.43 GBP.

This fee will be charged to your first account after the reactivation of the service.

title: Setting up and managing parental control

fields.question: How can I change the level of parental protection?
fields.answer:
Parental control is applied when the Family Viewer profile is selected.

The parental control level is set when the service is first installed, but can be changed at any time from the Threats menu: Settings / Profiles / Edit Family Profile / Can See

The set level of parental control is applied to the digital receiver, but also to other devices through which the TV service is used (smartphone, tablet, computer, etc.).

To watch all TV and video content without the PIN, except erotica, you must set the parental control level to 18

fields.question: What is a Parental Control PIN?
fields.answer: The factory default PIN for parental protection is 1111.

fields.question: Why am I required to enter a PIN for certain content?
fields.answer:
After turning on the digital receiver, the default viewer profile is Family. With the Family profile, you can only view and display TV and video content that complies with the parental control level set (see Parental Control). In this profile, content that does not match the set parental control level can only be viewed and displayed with a PIN entry.

The parental control level can be changed in the Threat menu: Settings / Profiles / Edit Profile Family / Can see.

To view all TV and video content without the PIN, except erotica, you must set the parental control level to 18.

fields.question: What is parental protection?
fields.answer:
These and other "I want to know more" instructions can be found on the user interface TV itself under the shortcut "Help".

The TV service contains two profiles for the Family and Parents' viewers. The Family profile includes the Parental Controls service, which protects children and minors from inappropriate TV and video content, so a PIN is required to view and watch such content.

There are 5 levels of Parental Controls that define the age of the child/minor, limiting access to inappropriate content.

fields.question: What levels of parental protection are there?
fields.answer:
This and other "I want to know more" instructions can be found on the user interface of TV under the shortcut "Help".

Parental control is applied when the Family Viewer profile is selected.

There are 5 levels of parental control:

  • U - the strictest level, where content suitable for children 4 years and older is available for viewing/watching without a PIN,
  • PG - content suitable for children 8 years and older is available for viewing/watching without a PIN,
  • 12 - the content shown is not suitable for persons under 12,
  • 15 - the content shown is not suitable for persons under 15,
  • 18 - the content shown is not suitable for persons under 18.

The set level of protection of minors is applied on the digital receiver, but also on other devices through which the TV service is used (smartphone, tablet, computer, etc.).

To watch all TV and video content without the PIN, except erotica, it is necessary to set the level of protection of minors to 18.

fields.question: How can I turn off parental protection?
fields.answer:
The parental control service is included in the Family Viewer profile and cannot be turned off. To view all TV and video content in this profile without PIN, except for erotic content, you must set the parental control level to 18.

In addition to the Family profile, the Parent profile is also available. The Parent's profile allows access to all TV and video content, including erotic, without having to enter a PIN. This profile is applied until the Family profile is selected again or the digital receiver is switched off.

fields.question: How to opt out of receiving marketing emails
fields.answer:
To unsubscribe from marketing emails, select ‘unsubscribe’ at the bottom of the email.

Once you’ve been removed from our marketing list, we may still contact you with non-marketing communications such as bill notifications or changes to your terms and conditions.

fields.question: What is the GDPR and how does it affect me as a user?
fields.answer:
The General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) is a general regulation on the protection of personal data adopted by the European Parliament and the Council of the European Union, which aims to give citizens control over the use of their personal data and to provide a high level of protection.

Proof that you have released your data for use is called "consent", in any form - digital or paper.

At Telecom, we collect two types of consent from all of our users, individuals:

  • Consent to be contacted - by which you give us permission to contact you from time to time with the offer of our products and services, for example, with the offer of a new device at the time of renewal of your contract.
  • Consent to the analysis of personal data - by which you give us permission to provide you with service or technical support tailored to your needs and consumption in relation to the location of your device

We always keep your data carefully and ensure its security.

fields.question: What is a consent agreement?
fields.answer: By ordering from us, you agree you've read and accepted the following terms: Terms and conditions.

fields.question: How did you get my information?
fields.answer: We collect personal data about you in 4 primary ways: Directly from you, like when you create an account with us. Automatically from your use of our products and services, like data associated with using our network. From other sources, like information from financial institutions and credit agencies.

fields.question: What details will I need to move my services?

Our online form outlines all the information we will need to move your services to your new address correctly.

An outline of what we will need is below:

  • Account No
  • Contact information
  • Your old and new address

Full details are visible on our digital agent.

fields.question: What notifications will I receive?
fields.answer:
You will receive an email notifying you of the completion of your home move, as well as an email confirming the cancellation of service at your previous address.

Please note; If you have mobile(s) you will get an additional email, advising of a new order, disregard this email as it is not relevant. This is to ensure your mobile(s) are in your bundle at your new address.

fields.question: Can I keep my plan and promotions?
fields.answer: Offers vary by area. If you can’t keep your current plan, you can shop for new offers. If you’re moving to an area where our provider doesn’t provide service, just return your equpiment before you move. We can help you do that, too.

fields.question: What happens to my equipment?
fields.answer: You may be able to bring your equipment with you. If you need new equipment, you can schedule a professional installation and a technician will take care of everything. Or, we can show you how to install it yourself.

fields.question: Do I have to pay to move my services?
fields.answer: There is no early termination fee when you keep your service provider, or switch to a new offer. In fact, many customers transfer service to a new home at no cost. If you’d like help installing equipment when you get there, or if your move requires a professional, you may be charged an installation fee. You’ll always get our 30-day money-back guarantee for TV, Internet, and Voice services.

title: Can I take my existing phone number with me when I move house?
description: taking phone number with me when i move house

fields.question: Can I keep my current phone number if I switch all my services from another provider?
fields.answer: If you're moving home within your own telephone exchange area you may be able to take your current phone number with you. There's no charge for this service. We'll let you know if you can keep your number and your expected broadband speed when you organise your home move online.

fields.question: If I am tranferring my services, should i take my equipment with me?
fields.answer: If you are transferring your services to a new address, you may be able to take your equipment with you.

fields.question: Will there be a break in your service?
fields.answer:
We aim to ensure that your move to your new provider will be a seamless process with no loss in service.

Activating your new service will take up to 10 working days. This timeframe takes into account situations where you may need a new line installed in your home.

fields.question: Giving notice to your current provider?
fields.answer:
In most instances a service provider requires 30 days' notice of your intention to cancel or cease the service.

Your account payments must also be up to date before moving your service to another provider. We recommend checking with your provider for their exact terms.

fields.question: What time will the technician call to my home?
fields.answer:
Morning Appointments: 

  • 09:00AM - 13:30PM

Afternoon Appointments:

  • 2:30PM - 16:30PM

All Day Appointments: 

  • 09:00AM - 16:30PM

fields.question: Need to change or reschedule your appointment?
fields.answer:
Your appointment will take place within a timeframe. If you booked a morning appointment, the technician may arrive any time within 9am-13:30pm. If you booked an afternoon appointment, the technician may arrive any time between 12:30pm - 16:30pm.

If the technician does not arrive within the expected window, get in touch with us here (put cempresso tool ur).

fields.question: Anything else I need to know?

  • Fibre is intalled via overhead wires or underground cable depending on the setup of the property

fields.question: What are the next steps after you’ve disconnected?

You’ll get your final bill 14 days after you’re disconnected.

You can check your final bill online in MyTelecom portal, but not in the MyTelecom app, as it’ll stop working once you’re disconnected.

fields.question: How much notice is required for cancelling a service?
fields.answer:
All our products and bundles have a contract term. If you cancel within this time you will be issued an early cease charge (or ECC). What you're charged depends on how long is left in your contract.

For more information please visit our Terms and conditions section.

fields.question: The account holdet has passed away. What should I do?
fields.answer:
We understand that when this occurs it will be a difficult time for family members and as such have created a process for the Telecom account to be managed in a timely manner.

You can now complete our bereavement form(put cempresso tool) so we can either; cancel the service or transfer it to another family member to continue to use it.

There is no notice period or termination fees where the account holder has passed away.

fields.question: Do I need to return my equipment when I cease?
fields.answer:
If you cancel your services, you will need to return all Fibre Broadband and TV equipment within 30 days of the cancellation date. We will send you a letter once your service has been cancelled with details on how to return your equipment.

Please ensure you include all

  • Cables
  • Power adapters
  • Home plug extenders

Failure to return all equipment could mean you are liable for equipment charges.

More information and charges here.

fields.question: What do I need to know about contract obligation?
fields.answer: Based on signing a contract with us, you are entitled to a discount on a monthly fee or similar promotions, so it is always better to buy a service with a contractual obligation. The contractual obligation can last 12 or 24 months. You can terminate the service prematurely, and you can find more about the conditions for terminating the contract here.

fields.question: My service is not active yet, and the device has been delivered to me, what does that mean?
fields.answer: It is common for your device to arrive before the date for which the service has been agreed upon, so it is important to know that you will only be able to start using the service from that date.

fields.question: By when do I have to renew my account?
fields.answer:
You can easily check this by entering * 101 # and the call key on the screen of your device.

In addition to the account balance, you can see the expiration of the account here, which depends on the top-up of the account with the voucher.

fields.question: At what price do I talk when I activate my SIM card?
fields.answer: The basic price of a call to all networks is the same: 1.29 GBP / min, the price of an SMS is 0.33 GBP, the price of an MMS is 0.88 GBP, and the price of 1 MB is 1.29 GBP. You do not pay the call set-up fee :) Check all the prices here, and to make the prices even more affordable, be sure to activate one of the monthly packages, according to your needs and habits.

fields.question: How to activate or deactivate a package?
fields.answer: You can activate the package by sending a free SMS message to 19191 or via the mobile web. The same goes for package deactivation.

fields.question: What is the difference between prepaid and post paid on T-Mobile?
fields.answer: On a prepaid phone plan, you pay for your service upfront, and with a postpaid plan, you pay your bill at the end of the month. As such, the main difference between a prepaid and postpaid plan is when you pay for it, but there are a few other differences as well.

fields.question: Why is prepaid cheaper?
fields.answer: The main advantage of prepaid phone plans over contract plans is lower pricing. With prepaid service, you have the freedom to buy exactly what you need. If you only text, SMS-only plans are available. You can also find plans that offer unlimited calling and data if that's what you need.

fields.question: How long does a prepaid phone last?
fields.answer: Prepaid phones are cell phones that have a monthly service that is not contract-based. Instead, you purchase the airtime and data you need one month at a time. If you don't want to buy any one month, you can skip it and then renew the next month if you like

title: How to control costs on prepaid

fields.question: Why would I activate a monthly package?
fields.answer: Each of us knows if he likes to talk or text more and if he needs MB to surf the internet. You don't have to pay for what you don't need but make the combination that suits you best. The billing unit for package calls is 1 second, for the Internet it is 10 KB, and you do not pay the call set-up fee

fields.question: Why can't I spend the money transferred to my account?
fields.answer: Make sure your account is active. The money that someone transfers to your account does not renew or extend the validity of your account: you will have to do it yourself by top-up the voucher. When you renew your account, you will be able to use the money transferred to you.

fields.question: How can I change the tariff on prepaid account?
fields.answer: You can change and choose a tariff by sending a free SMS with content A to 19191 and choose one of the tariffs on the prepaid we offer

fields.question: Will my new tariff be automatically renewed after 30 days?
fields.answer: If you have enough money in your account to renew your tariff, your tariff will be automatically renewed after 30 days.

fields.question: How can I check the remaining minutes, messages, and MB?
fields.answer: You can check the status of minutes, SMS messages, and MB via the tariff by sending an SMS to the number 13232 with the USSD code * 102 * 1 # and the call key.

fields.question: How are minutes and SMSs distributed within the tariff?
fields.answer: Our services are designed so that you get 10.000 units per month, and you spend them as you like. Whether you will spend all of them on surfing (in which case 10.000 units is equal to 10GB of data) you can, or you can spend it on a combination of services (1 unit is equal to a 1 minute of call or 1 SMS).

fields.question: What is the unit of account for consumption in the tariff?
fields.answer:
• The unit of account for minutes is 60/60.
  • The unit of account for data traffic within the tariff is 100kB
  • The unit of account for data traffic after the spent tariff (package billing) is 1MB

fields.question: How much minimum do I need to have in my voucher account to be able to connect to the internet?
fields.answer: You must have at least 1 MB in your account. But given the size of the pages on the internet, the amount probably won’t be enough to open all the pages or apps.

fields.question: What is the difference between one-off and recurring options?
fields.answer: One-time options expire automatically when they expire, while recurring options are automatically renewed if you have enough in your account to charge for the option.

fields.question: Can I replace all the minutes / SMS, or MB I have?
fields.answer:
You can only exchange minutes / SMS and MB from the tariff. Minutes / SMS and MB from options or promotions cannot be swapped.

You must always have at least 100 MB and 10 minutes / SMS reserved, i.e., they cannot be replaced. You will be notified by SMS after each replacement.

fields.question: Are minutes and SMS messages and MB transferred to me in the next month and how many?
fields.answer:
Yes, unspent minutes / SMS messages and MB are transferred to the next month.

The maximum amount that can be transferred is twice the amount of the regular content of the tariff.

fields.question: In which case is a change in the tariff charged?
fields.answer:
There is no charge for changing tariffs on new tariffs.

You can change the tariff free of charge whenever you want, and you can activate another of the new tariffs.

fields.question: Can I use the services while abroad?
fields.answer:
You can use your services (calls, SMS, surfing) while abroad. After entering a foreign country, you will receive information via SMS about the prices of calls, SMS and MMS messages and data traffic.

If you are in one of the EEA countries, which includes the EU, Liechtenstein, Norway, and Iceland, you will also receive information on the amount of the threshold for using data traffic at domestic prices.

fields.question: By when do I have to renew my account?
fields.answer:
You can easily check this by entering * 101 # and the call key on the screen of your device.

In addition to the account balance, you can see the expiration of the account here, which depends on the top-up of the account with the voucher.

fields.question: What amounts of vouchers do you offer and how much do they cost?
fields.answer:
The price of the voucher is equal to the amount of the voucher that will be added to your account with its top-up.

There are the following amounts of vouchers: A voucher for GBP 30, a voucher for GBP 60, a voucher for GBP 90, a voucher for GBP 120, and a voucher for GBP 240.

There is also a voucher of 15 GBP which is available only through the application and on the webshop.

fields.question: How long is my account valid after voucher top-up?
fields.answer: A voucher of GBP 240 will extend your account duration (active account period) by 180 days, a voucher of GBP 120 by 120 days, and all other vouchers will extend your account by 90 days.

fields.question: What are top up vouchers?
fields.answer: A top-up card is a card bought by a mobile-phone user entitling him or her to an amount of credit for future usage (calls, SMS, data, etc.).

fields.question: Does top up credit expire?
fields.answer: Top up credit does not expire, it's the SIM you need to keep active with regular chargeable activity or top up, it is recommended this is done every 90 day

fields.question: What payment options do you offer?
fields.answer:
You have the following payment options in the Telecom online shop:

  • Cash on delivery
  • Credit card
  • PayPal - for selected products

fields.question: Until when can I withdraw from my online purchase?
fields.answer:
If you have ordered from the Telecom online shop, you can return the purchased items to us within 14 days.

Repayment

When paying by credit card, the repayment will be processed directly by the credit card company.

If you pay cash on delivery, you will receive the purchase price back by postal order.

The repayment or chargeback of Telecom points takes about 2 to 3 weeks.
