title: Order cancelation
description: Find out more about ways to cancel your order, returning malfunctioning device and submitting refund claim.

fields.question: Can I cancel an order if I change my mind?
fields.answer:
Our returns policy gives you 14 days to change your mind, whatever the reason, and you can cancel or return your order within 14 days from when you receive the order. Charges may apply for use of the Services until you cancel your order.

Our 14-day returns policy doesn't apply to:

  • Business customers. Please speak to your account manager or Prime Contact for details;
  • Digital products and unsealed software, such as music and games which have been unsealed, downloaded, or used (unless the products are faulty, see Faulty products - What do I do if my Equipment or Service is faulty? section below);
  • Equipment ordered from another company - you'll have to go back to them to find out what to do; 
  • Installation services (or similar services) that have been provided prior to your cancellation of the order.

title: Billing & invoices
description: Here you can find all you need about bills, payments and dispute management
keywords: bill, refund, bill dispute, charges, costs, payment

title: Billing FAQs
description: Key information about billing and invoices

fields.question: Key things you need to know about billing!
fields.answer:
• The accounting period lasts from 1 to 30/31. in a month and the same cannot be changed.
  • We send the invoice once a month, a few days after the end of the calendar month. The invoice will arrive at your home address around the 10th of the month for the previous month and by e-mail a few days before.
  • The due date for payment of the invoice should be around the 16th of the month.
  • It is listed in the upper right corner of each monthly bill.
  • If the subscription agreement is signed in the middle of the month and you use a tariff with a monthly fee or subscription, you will only pay the costs for the period from the day of inclusion to the end of the calendar month.

fields.question: By when do I have to pay the bill?
fields.answer: The invoice must be paid by the due date specified on the invoice payment slip.

fields.question: How can I pay my bill?
fields.answer: You can pay bills by general payment slip (payment order or bank transfer), direct debit, Call and pay service, the credit card on My Telecom service, or e-payment via internet banking.

fields.question: How do I know my bills have been paid?
fields.answer: On your last bill, below the cost information on the home page, you will find information about the status of your possible debts. If all bills have been paid, below the statement is the message "All previous bills have been paid, thank you." If this is not the case, the message "At the time of issuing this invoice, the amount of your debt is xxx, yy GBP." is displayed in the same place. You can settle the total debt by calling the number of the last payment slip. The amount will then be automatically credited to all open accounts.

fields.question: When will I receive my first bill?
fields.answer: We send the invoice once a month, a few days after the end of the calendar month. The invoice will arrive at your home address by the 10th of the month for the previous month, and by e-mail in our application a few days earlier.

fields.question: Can I receive an invoice in other currencies?
fields.answer: No, we issue our bills in EUR. If you pay the invoice from abroad and cannot pay in EUR, you can pay the invoice in GBP at the middle exchange rate of the National Bank to the same IBAN as for payments in EUR (IBAN from the invoice payment slip).

fields.question: I have outstanding bills. If I pay off part of the debt, which account will you close?
fields.answer: If you have outstanding bills, each of your payments closes the oldest debt.

fields.question: I signed the contract in the middle of the month, how much will I pay the first subscription?
fields.answer: If you use a tariff with a monthly fee or subscription, you will only pay the costs for the period from the day of entrance to the end of the calendar month.

fields.question: I’ve been abroad, but I still don’t see my spending?
fields.answer: The display of the cost of using the line abroad can be delayed from a few days to a month.

fields.question: What is the SMS bill service?
fields.answer:
No matter where you are, you can now receive your bill via SMS.

The service is very easy to use and does not require special registration and login of user data.

Just "click" on the link in the SMS and the invoices are available for viewing on a special website.

You will receive an SMS invoice every month after the billing for services is completed.

title: Key things to know about our e-bill

fields.question: What is an e-Invoice?
fields.answer: An electronic invoice without a paper version is a way to receive invoices only electronically. If you activate this service, the invoice will no longer be sent to your home address in paper form.

fields.question: Who can use the e-invoice service?
fields.answer: The e-invoice service can be used by private and business subscribers using any service from our portfolio.

fields.question: What are the benefits of an e-invoice service?
fields.answer:
The biggest advantage of an electronic invoice is that in this way we collectively protect nature and reduce paper consumption.

If you activate electronic billing, you will receive your bill to your e-mail address in the shortest possible time. No matter where you are, you can view your bill at any time and pay it on time. For each new bill you receive by email, you will also receive a notification by SMS.

title: Buying a device on your telecom bill

fields.question: Can I buy a device and charge it to my invoice?
fields.answer: Yes, you can. You will repay the installments on the monthly bill of telecommunication services, but you need to sign a contract obligation for your telecom services.

fields.question: How does the partial payment for device through my telecommunication bill work?
fields.answer:
With the partial payment, you can pay the price of your device in 24 monthly installments. The partial amount depends on your initial deposit. You can find your partial payments after the gross sum of the basic and connection charges on your bill.

If needed, early payment of your device is possible at any time.

The partial payment is free of charge and does not trigger any interest or processing fees. You can use partial payment in all shops and in the online shop.

fields.question: Where in the bill do I see the installment for the device I am repaying?
fields.answer: The amount of the device's repayment in installments is visible under the item "Device repayment in installments". You will easily recognize it by the mark 1/24 or 2/24… It is also the mark of the installment you pay.

title: Key things to know about our invoices

fields.question: Are we paperless?
fields.answer: To cut down on paper waste, we try to keep your bills digital – so we won't send you paper bills unless you specifically ask for them. If you want to receive paper bills in the post, you'll need to opt in.

fields.question: What is our billing cycle?
fields.answer: You'll get your first bill within a couple of days of joining us. You'll be charged for the first few days of your plan, plus the next full month – we bill this in advance each month.

fields.question: What is the billing period?
fields.answer: Billing periods are the dates on your bill representing the period during which you were charged for products, services, and usage. The billing period is automatically assigned to you when you register your contract. It does not always correspond to the date of your registration or a calendar month (01.-30.).

title: Your bill explained

fields.question: What does minus mean on the invoice?
fields.answer: That's what a minus usually means so the amount is a refund of some sort on your invoice.

fields.question: Where in the account do I see the installment for the device I am repaying?
fields.answer: The amount of the device's repayment in installments is visible under the item "Device repayment in installments". You will easily recognize it by the mark 1/24 or 2/24… It is also the mark of the installment you pay.

fields.question: What does everything show on the call specification?
fields.answer:
We are sending a printout of the call as an attachment to the invoice. It shows all the services used: calls, messages, data transfer…

The specification for each call, text message, or data transfer provides the following information:

  • date and time of establishing a call and/or data transfer, ie sending an SMS message
  • call duration and/or amount of data transferred
  • the dialed number and/or access point through which the data was transferred, ie the number to which the SMS message was sent
  • price per minute / SMS (without VAT)
  • the total price of the call or other services (excluding VAT)

fields.question: How is the early termination of the contract charged?
fields.answer:
Early termination of the contract, i.e. termination of the contract before the expiry of the contractually agreed minimum period of use, is charged according to the valid pricelist and in accordance with the General Terms and Conditions.

In this sense, anyone who decides to terminate the contract completely before the expiry of the contractual obligation shall pay what is more favorable for him in between:

  • monthly fees for the remaining term of the contract or compensation in the amount of the discount on the products and services he received, if this option exists.

If you terminate your contract, the early termination fee will be applied to your last regular monthly bill.

If you use the services of fixed-line Internet, TV, or 5G Internet for less than 6 months, you will pay a fee of GBP 50 per service when you terminate the contract.

When terminating fixed-line services, it is of course necessary to return the equipment in order to avoid the fees for non-returned equipment. If you wish to cancel the contract, you will receive a letter at your home address listing the equipment.

fields.question: I received a larger bill than the amount shown to me as spending. Why?
fields.answer:
The amount of current spending is for information purposes only and you cannot use it as a basis for paying bills.

The amount shown does not include:

  • monthly fees
  • VAT
  • all discounts you get (including free calls)
  • transactions made the previous day

fields.question: Why did you charge my account for the full price of the device, and I requested payment for the device in installments?
fields.answer:
On the first invoice, you are not charged the full price of the device, but we only show you the amount you will repay in installments for information.

The next issued invoices under the item "Repayment of devices in installments" will show you the repayment of devices in installments (02/24, 03/24…).

fields.question: Why is my bill bigger than usual?
fields.answer:
Some of the most common reasons for an increased bill are:

  • Stay abroad or in the border area
  • Use the services of other companies
  • Repayment of the device in installments
  • Reminder cost
  • Using smartphones
  • Contract termination

You can find more detailed information in the questions and answers below.

fields.question: Can you check my data balance?
fields.answer: To check your current month's usage on your Android phone, go to Settings > Connections > Data Usage. The screen shows your billing period and the amount of cellular data you've used so far.

keywords: bill installment e-bill data balance refund

fields.question: What is the billing period?
fields.answer: The billing period is your billing period. The billing period is automatically assigned to you when you register your contract. It does not always correspond to the date of your registration or a calendar month (01.-30.).

fields.question: Which items will my bill contain?
fields.answer:
1. Contract information (name and surname of the service owner, personal ID number, address, account number, customer code).
  2. Dates (date of issue and due date)
  3. Services break-down 
    1. Category of service (mobile, internet, voice, television, etc.)
    2. Name of the service or a fee detailed breakdown of the total amount of expenses, how much is included in the monthly fee, amount in EUR, discount, total amount in EUR
    3. VAT amount 
    4. Additional services with special billing 
    5. Total amount to be paid

fields.question: How can I pay my invoice?
fields.answer: Of course, you can, we support it because it's more environmentally friendly :) You can get your e-bill by filling out the form, or within the Telekom application.

fields.question: I'm late with paying my bills, what's going to happen?
fields.answer:
Each invoice must be paid by the indicated due date of the invoice.

  • If you do not pay it on time, you will receive a payment reminder. If you still do not pay the bill, we will send you a reminder with a new due date, and after that, we will announce the temporary disconnection of the line by SMS or call.
  • In the event of a temporary disconnection, the costs of charging, interest, and re-inclusion fees will be charged in accordance with the applicable price list and shown in the following invoice.

When we receive your payment and initiate the line reconnection process, we will notify you via SMS.

fields.question: Can I pay the invoice from abroad?
fields.answer:
You can pay the invoice by bank transfer. To reduce the cost of the transfer, check which foreign bank has a contract with Royal Bank of Scotland.

We recommend that you choose the option to pay the bank charges yourself when filling out the order. Otherwise, the bank will automatically retain the amount for its costs, and Telecom will receive an amount too small to close the account. The time needed to post the payment depends on the country, the bank, and the day of the payment.

Payment information:

Name of the bank: Royal Bank of Scotland

Address: 36 St Andrew Square, Edinburgh, EH2 2YB

BIC code: RBOSGB2L

IBAN: GB29NWBK60161331926819

fields.question: I have an open bills. How can I check the total amount and payment information?
fields.answer: You can check the total amount of the open account and the payment information by sending an SMS with the content of DEBT to the number 19191.

fields.question: Will I be notified about your steps in collection?
fields.answer:
• The due date of the invoice is variable and is usually 13 days from the date of issuance of the invoice (depending on Sundays and holidays that occur in the meantime)
  • Two working days after the due date, we will send you an SMS reminder.
  • We send a written reminder no earlier than 5 working days from the due date.
  • 30 working days from the written reminder we will disable your outgoing traffic (of course if you have not paid the reminder), but we will notify you by SMS beforehand.
  • We are permanently terminating your contract with you for 35 days from disabling outgoing traffic and you are losing your number forever :(
  • A court procedure will be initiated no later than 5 days after the termination of the contract.

fields.question: I pay bills by standing order, but I don't have enough money in my current account. What should I do?
fields.answer: If you do not have enough money in your current account to collect your monthly bill, the bill must be paid with a general payment slip.

fields.question: I have few outstanding bills. If I pay off part of the debt, which bill will you close?
fields.answer: If you have outstanding bills, each of your payments closes the oldest debt.

fields.question: I can’t pay. When will I receive a dunning letter?
fields.answer: Before we send you a reminder, we'll remind you by email or email, depending on which service you're using, that you haven't paid your bill. If you do not settle it after that, we will send you a reminder to do so by a certain date. If you still do not respond, we will temporarily disconnect you. Ignore the reminder if you have paid the bill by the deadline we have indicated.

fields.question: What are Additional Services from other companies?
fields.answer:
It is an external service provider, i.e., companies that provide users with various services via SMS or calls. These can be prize games, chats, etc.

  • These services can be identified by shortcodes on the account:
  • 6XXXX for premium SMS (e.g., prize games, voting, user login to various services, SMS chat)
  • 8XXXX for content billing and/or additional information services (subscriptions, downloads of games, music, pictures, etc.)
  • 060 numbers - general content services
  • 060 9XX XXX - for humanitarian actions
  • 061 numbers - telephone voting services
  • 064 numbers - services with content inappropriate for children
  • 065 numbers - prize game services
  • 069 numbers - services intended for children

fields.question: I live in a border area. How can I avoid switching to a foreign network?
fields.answer:
To avoid switching to foreign networks you can do this:

  • include bans on international and roaming calls
  • set the manual network search on the mobile phone and select the domestic network or
  • put foreign networks that are "interfering" in the list of prohibited networks if your mobile phone supports this feature.

fields.question: Why is my bill bigger than usual?
fields.answer:
Some of the most common reasons for an increased bill are:

  • Stay abroad or in the border area
  • Use the services of other companies
  • Repayment of the device in installments
  • Reminder cost
  • Using smartphones
  • Contract termination

You can find more detailed information in the questions and answers below.

fields.question: What is the difference between international and roaming calls?
fields.answer:
International calls are calls that you make to international numbers (fixed or mobile) while you are in the country, and do not refer to calls made to another domestic number, even if it is abroad.

Roaming calls are all calls you make while you are abroad, regardless of the number you call.

fields.question: I am abroad, and I can’t surf. Why?
fields.answer:
1. Make sure that the mobile data in your phone is activated and that Data Roaming is turned on.

2. Check that the APN settings are well configured: Internet.

3. Try turning off / on the mobile phone to log in to the network again.

4. In case it still doesn't work, try to change the operator manually.

fields.question: If I am abroad, do I pay for incoming calls?
fields.answer:
If you are in one of the EEA Member States (EU countries, Liechtenstein, Norway, and Iceland), you do not pay for incoming calls. In all other countries abroad, you pay for both incoming and outgoing calls.

Prices depend on the roaming price list you have and the country you are in.

fields.question: I live in a border area. How can I avoid switching to foreign networks?
fields.answer:
To avoid switching to foreign networks you can do this:

  • include bans on international and roaming calls
  • set the manual network search on the mobile phone and select the A1 Croatia network or
  • put foreign networks that are "interfering" in the list of prohibited networks if your mobile phone supports this feature.

fields.question: What does everything show on the call specification?
fields.answer:
We are sending a printout of the call as an attachment to the invoice. It shows all the services used: calls, messages, data transfer…

The specification for each call, text message, or data transfer provides the following information:

  • date and time of establishing a call and/or data transfer, ie sending an SMS message
  • call duration and/or amount of data transferred
  • the dialed number and/or access point through which the data was transferred, ie the number to which the SMS message was sent
  • price per minute / SMS (without VAT)
  • the total price of the call or other services (excluding VAT)

fields.question: Are there any charges for emergency calls while I am abroad?
fields.answer: No. Calls to all Telecom users of the Emergency Service are free of charge, regardless of whether you are calling from abroad or from within the country.

fields.question: How can I check the current MB consumption?
fields.answer: You can always check the consumption by sending an SMS with “?” on the number 19191.

fields.question: Will I receive a notification after I have used up all the MB in the tariff package?
fields.answer: When you spend data traffic included in the monthly fee of your tariff, you will receive an SMS notification of an informative nature.

fields.question: Switching / changing service provider
fields.answer:
Landline Phone and Broadband Switching or Changing Service Provider

We hope you're happy with your service, however, if you have decided to leave eir we've put together what you need to know. You can complete the termination of your services by either Switching or Ceasing.

The steps for switching and ceasing are slightly different, so please make sure to follow the correct instructions below.

  • Switching means you want to move your landline phone number and/or broadband to a different service provider.
  • If you are switching only your phone number to another provider your new provider will be responsible for initiating the switching process. You do not need to contact eir. This also applies in most cases when switching your phone number and broadband.

In the following cases:

  • You do not have a landline phone number (i.e. you have a broadband service only)
  • You have a landline phone and broadband service but you are not keeping your landline phone number
  • If you are on an eir Broadband Talk plan (a voice over broadband (VoBB) service) and you intend to move your landline number to another service provider


You will need to contact eir to terminate your remaining eir service(s).

If you need to contact us to terminate any of your services when switching to a new provider please use one of the following:

Phone: xxxx xxx xxx


Post:
Telecom Customer Value Management,
Telecom Building,
Telecom Street 10,
Telecom City,
Country.

For verification purposes and to ensure the best possible customer experience, you will need the following pieces of information for the call or letter.

  • Your name and address as they appear on your Telecom bill
  • Your account number (this can be found on your Telecom bill)
  • Your landline telephone number including prefix/area code
  • Which service(s) you wish to move to a new provider

You will receive confirmation of the cessation in writing.

You can use the below termination letter template if you choose.

There are a few other things you need to be aware of:

If you are within the minimum term for your contract you will be liable for an early termination charge. We will bill you for this charge after your services terminate. The amount you will be charged will be calculated based on the number of days you have left on your minimum contract term.

When you terminate your service(s) you must return any Telecom TV and broadband equipment to us within 30 days following your termination date. You will be charged a fee for any equipment not returned to us within this deadline and we'll send you a bill for any unreturned equipment charges after your services are terminated.

fields.question: Important information about equipment returns
fields.answer:
If you have recently cancelled some or all of your services, it is imperative that you return Fibre modem and TV equipment to eir within 30 days of the cancellation date.
Failure to return all equipment to eir will mean you will be liable for equipment charges which are outlined below. This charge will be added to a customer's final bill.

You must return all cables, power adapters, home plug extenders or any other accessories.

Please note Fibre to the Home customers should not return the optical fibre termination point (ONT) as it is used by other service providers.

Equipment descriptionCharge for non-return (inc. Vat)
Fibre Modem€59.99
TV box €100.00
TV Set-Top box€80.00
Multi-room box€40.00

Returning your equipment is so simple. There are 3 methods of returns to choose from which are explained further below. We cover the cost of all of these return options, so there is no cost to you.

You can return your equipment by:

  • Dropping it to a nearest Post office location
  • Booking a courier to collect from an address of your choices
  • Dropping to an Telecom retail store (Please note you must have received a returns letter first)
